item.title: Choo, choo, Graeme is 2!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Today Graeme turns 2.  He has quickly grown into an adventurous little boy who loves trains, balls, anything with wheels, and his mommy (much to daddy’s dismay at times).  He is sweet at times, aggressive at others, but always determined. Some stats on Graeme today:

Favorite songs: Thomas theme song, Itsy Bitsy Spider, ABCs
He’s heavier than Maggie was at this age, weighing in at 28lbs, but the same heigh at 34 inches. 
His vocabulary has been bursting in recent weeks – everything from “train table” to “Graeme do” to “Happy daddy day” for Father’s day to “Clay Buchholz” (when Pat asks who threw a no hitter!)

With our recent move, things have been hectic in Graeme’s life and he’s taken it all like a champ – new house, new bedroom, new school – all done without much fuss. He’s proven to be an easily adaptable kid – as long as there’s trains to distract him! We had a little party with some of his friends/cousins – of course, as it goes with 2nd children, only took a few photos!

 

 

video: Happy Birthday, Graeme!

item.title: London calling
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Monday we returned home from 10 days in the UK.  We stayed with my Great Aunt Bernie and Great Uncle Jim at their lovely house in Kent, Treetop.  Both kids loved exploring the place, and Maggie enjoyed being able to have private art lessons courtesy of Jim.  I have many fond memories of visiting Treetop as a child, and hope Maggie and Graeme will too! We were able to do some day trips, despite a variety of illnesses that struck down each one of us at some stage! While traveling with kids definitely had it’s struggles (note: the enclosed capsules of the London Eye are not ideal for a screaming 14 month old….), I think we all enjoyed being in England, and I’m sure to be fielding many questions for when we’ll be returning – especially as Maggie has already asked about when we’ll see baby Alexa again!

And we’re off!

London
We took the train up to the city twice, the first time to visit with Rachel and her family, and Gemma and her family, and the second time to tick off items on Maggie’s bucket list: ride the top of a double decker bus, see Big Ben, go on the London Eye, and see Peter Pan.

                   

Hever Castle
Maggie also wanted to “see a real Queen’s castle”.

    

Rochester
First photo was taken by Maggie – nice to have a budding photographer in the family!

       

Kew Gardens
Not many photos – but beautiful park with a treetop walkway the kids loved and a fantastic playground.

Treetop
The real highlight of the trip was the time spent with family – the kids meeting their great, great aunt and uncle, us getting to meet baby Lexie, and lots of time spent just catching up!

item.title: A very colorful 4th birthday
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: Today we celebrated Maggie’s 4th birthday with LOTS of rainbows!  Thankfully, despite a forecast all week of rain, it held off and we were able to enjoy an evening of fun, friends, and cake!

item.title: Happy Holidays
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We had a wonderful holiday season – Maggie really started to understand what was going on this year and was so excited.  We embraced every opportunity to celebrate the holidays including a night to Edaville Railroad, a toddler-friendly showing of the Nutcracker by the Metrowest Ballet and of course, lots of visits with friends and family!

The lead up….

  

Christmas!

and New Years!

item.title: Erin Go Bragh
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Having not been on a European vacation since Maggie arrived, we decided to get our feet wet by traveling with the McArdles to Ireland for 10 days.  We spent time in Dublin, Armagh, and Roscommon, with day visits to Dun Laoghaire and Galway.

Dublin

After arriving Friday morning, we spent the next 3 days being tourists in Dublin – visiting the Guinness Storehouse, St Stephen’s Green (multiple times for the playground!), Grafton Street, and lots more through the Dublin Road Train tour.  It was definitely a different experience visiting Dublin with a toddler – all the places (read: pubs) I’d visited in my most recent trips didn’t seem to be the best places for Maggie! We did find Dublin to be really child friendly though and even when we ended up in a pub, they were really welcoming!

Maggie having a blast touring Dublin

Dun Laoghaire

We had planned on visiting Dun Laoghaire for a day anyways, but when our great uncle Tom passed away, we headed down on the day of the wake.  We only had a few hours to kill, and the weather was not on our side, but we still managed to walk the pier and get ice cream at Teddy’s. Though it was for a sad occasion, we were able to see family that we hadn’t planned on seeing and it was great to be able to catch up.  Uncle Tom was a great man and will be very sorely missed.

 

Armagh (Northern Ireland)

After the day in DL, we headed up north to the McArdle farm.  We spent the next few days here visiting with the cows, walking the fields, going to Gosford Forest Park, and doing some shopping.  It was great to finally get to see the famed farm that we had all heard so much about!

Roscommon

On Thursday, we headed to Nana’s hometown of Roscommon to stay with the Fallon family.  It’s been a while since I’ve been back to Roscommon, and while much has changed, seeing “Nana’s castle” and the Moran grave brought back lots of memories of trips to Ireland as a kid.  We had a visit from our other cousin Ciara and her 2 little girls which was a great day (though poor Phelan was well outnumbered – 6 girls to 1 boy!).

The Fallon’s home was the perfect place to visit, kid-friendly, lots of space, and great hosts!  Maggie hasn’t stopped talking about Charlotte and Juliette – if only they lived closer!

 

Galway 

We popped into Galway for the day to see some family.  Was great to catch up with 2 of Nana’s sisters and lots of cousins – Pat finally understood why everyone is considered a “cousin”, even if technically they’re 2nd, 3rd, or even more distant, the extended Moran family is amazingly welcome to anyone who might share a drop of blood!  (We were too busy catching up to take any photos, but after brunch we wandered the city center a bit)

Fairy Day

The last day of the trip, we joined Steve, Goretti and the girls at a fundraiser Fairy Day – it was so sweet!! In honor of a local girl who was battling cancer, the fundraiser started last year and was a day of fun with fairies dancing, a magical walk through the woods, and lots of adorable little kids!

 

As with most vacations, it all went too quickly!! We’re missing everyone and already planning out the next time we can head over.  Maggie proved she’s a champion traveler with only taking 2 days on both ends to adjust to the time change and was great on the flights.

item.title: Joys of home ownership
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
So far we’ve been really lucky with our house – minimal work needed when we moved in, only minor issues so far – until recently.  We had been struggling with our heating system and not getting great pressure.  The Saturday before Thanksgiving, Pat and Cyril decided to see if they could get the pressure back up and with some fiddling they did….and it started raining in the dining room!  Turns out we had a hole in a pipe that had been slowly corroding for possibly years.

This lovely little leak led to a giant hole in our dining room ceiling, all the furniture being moved to the living room, and us being stuck with only 2 rooms of living space for a few weeks.

Thankfully right before this incident we had gotten Maggie a new table and chairs for her to color at – which made a great substitute dining set, albeit a little low to the ground!

 

As of now things are back to normal – just in time to start decorating for Christmas!!

item.title: Fall Fun
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Fall has always been my favorite season – give me anything and everything you can with apples, pumpkin, or cinnamon and I’m happy!  As with past years, we took full advantage of the weather and lots of seasonal activities…

…we picked apples.

….and played with pumpkins.

   

…and had playdates with lots of friends.

….and enjoyed a weekend in Maine for Tim and Amanda’s wedding!

 

and had a very Happy Halloween!

Other life updates – I started a new job in September as Sales & Marketing Program Manager at Medullan, it’s been an exciting and busy transition so far, but I’m loving it!  Pat is continually busy with clients and Maggie is growing up so much lately – getting more and more personality and becoming more independent every day.

As the weather gets colder we’ll be sad for the reduction in outdoor activities – thankfully we have the holidays to look forward to!

item.title: Maggie’s 1 Year Photos
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: The fabulous Katie Ryan from Katherinejane Photography took some great photos of Maggie to mark her 1st birthday – Enjoy!

item.title: A week in San Diego
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
As I had to attend a conference in San Diego, we decided to make a mini vacation for the 3 of us.  We left Boston bright and early Monday morning for the long flight to the west coast.  Maggie, now a seasoned traveler, took everything in stride and was great on the plane.  We picked up our rental car, and after a quick stop at In-N-Out, settled in to our first hotel in the Gaslamp district.

While I was working Tuesday and Wednesday, we had arranged for a babysitter to watch Maggie so Patrick could do some work as well.  Caprice, the sitter we found from Marion’s Childcare, was nothing short of fantastic! She took Maggie for walks around the area, brought toys for her, and kept us posted often throughout the days – it was great having someone so wonderful keep Maggie busy so we could both work.


Caprice and Maggie

Thursday afternoon started the holiday part of trip.  We started with lunch by the USS Midway and got to check out the statue of “The Homecoming” – was very cool.


Lunching!
 
Outside the USS Midway

Practicing walking with mommy’s colleague Harry

Friday we headed to the San Diego Zoo – it was a great day and despite being there from 9am to 3pm, Maggie was a champ! 2 naps in the stroller and not a single tear all day! The zoo was really impressive, the place is huge and really well maintained, we got there right when it opened and spent the first hour or so walking through exhibits with hardly another person in sight – definitely the best way to do it!

           

Saturday we met up with Pat’s old college friend Liz for breakfast, then we drove down to Coronado Beach for some sun and fun!  Maggie enjoyed her first beach trip and despite the chilly water, dipped her toes in the ocean – it was tough to get her to leave!

      

Our last day we drove north to Torrey Pines, Del Mar, and La Jolla – it was a quieter day just wondering the coast, a great ending to the week!

 

The hotel we stayed at for the 2nd half of our trip had a pool and we took advantage of it almost daily – Maggie is definitely like her mother, a little fish who loves the water!

 

The flight back today was nice as we had an extra seat in our row – amazing the difference a little more space can be!  It’s good to be back home, though am already missing the wonderful San Diego weather…will definitely be visiting again!
